Name: Requiring that all public meetings be webcast.
Title: A Local Law to amend the New York city charter, in relation to requiring that all public meetings be webcast.

History.Description: This Introduction was Introduced by Council
This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Technology in Government
This Introduction was Hearing Held by Committee
This Introduction was Amendment Proposed by Comm
This Introduction was Laid Over by Committee
This Introduction was Sine Die (Filed, End of Session)

Text:
Be it enacted by the Council as follows:

Section 1. Section 1063 of the New York city charter is amended by adding a new subdivision d to read as follows:
d. Each city agency, committee, commission and task force and the council shall record or cause to be recorded in digital video format its meetings and hearings, or portions thereof, that are subject to article seven of the public officers law.  Such recordings shall be webcast live, where practicable, and shall be archived and made available to the public on the city’s website or, in the case of the council, on the council’s website, not more than seventy-two hours after adjournment of the meeting or hearing recorded.
§2. This local law shall take effect ninety days after its enactment.
JTB
LS #2420-A
3/27/08
